boardgame.name: Navajo Wars
boardgame.description: Navajo Wars is a solitaire card driven game which places the player into the role of the Din_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute; (Navajo) from the time of the Spanish incursion in 1595 through the time of their subjugation at the hands of an American Army led by Kit Carson in 1864._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;Din_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; (pronounced 'dih-nay') is the word the Navajo use to refer to their tribe. It means _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;the people._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The term, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;Navajo_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; comes from a Spanish rendering of a Tewa (one of the Pueblo tribes) word for _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ldquo;planted fields._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;rdquo; The Din_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;eacute; were and are still known for their planting of corn in the high desert of New Mexico and Arizona._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The objective for the Navajo player, hereinafter referred to as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;player_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;, is to avoid being subjugated by either the Spanish, Mexicans or the Americans, hereinafter referred to as _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;enemy_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;. The player will be taking actions during the course of the game to try and increase both culture and military tracks. If both of those reach zero at any time during the game, you will be subjugated by the enemy and immediately lose the game. There are also cultural developments, in the form of a tech tree, that the player will have to develop to increase his chances of winning. The developments are; weaving, horsemanship, religion, masters of the Mesas and sharp trades each having three levels of development. Navajo Wars also has historical event cards for each period. These cards have their own rules and effects that really add a historical feel to the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;As the player, you will be trying to get your family units, _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;counter_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; on the map. Your family units could consist of a man, woman and child. With those counters you will be conducting individual actions with your families that are on the map. These actions could include, raids on New Mexico, raids on an outpost, tribal warfare _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; tribal diplomacy both conducted against the Comanche or the Ute. Create trade goods, husbandry and travel._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;During the enemy portion of the turn, the enemy will be conducting operations against the Navajo tribe. These operations could include: to subvert the natives (player), build outpost, build and subvert, raids (the enemy will try to send raids deep into the Navajo territory) and many other actions._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The enemy receives their orders by a unique order matrix. As the player, you are never sure what will be coming next._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Navajo Wars can be played as individual scenarios for the Spanish, Mexican and American periods. You can play all three periods as a campaign game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Historical Board Game Nominee

The box lid has five dings: one moderate one in the top right hand corner (also slightly dented in the same place on the box base); one moderate one in the bottom left hand corner; minor ones in the bottom right and top left corners; one minor one about halfway along the bottom edge. The box contents are in very good to as new condition. The counters are all punched and bagged; the cards removed from the shrink (and used in card sleeves); the rulebook and playbook have barely been touched. Thank you so much for your continued support of Wargame Depot which has allowed us to give generously to the VSF. Mint, in shrink copy available. No dings, no dents, or anything wrong with the game. Non-smoking environment and kept in a humidity-controlled location. $12 shipping to continental US - write me for a quote to the rest of the world. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the owner of Wargame Depot so a purchase from me will always be packed professionally and I can accept Paypal, MO/Check, or MC/Visa/Discover. North Carolina residents pay 7% sales tax. Cheers, Jason

This is for a used, but like new copy of Navajo Wars. I am the original owner and it has been played twice and carefully stored. Components and box are in excellent condition. My pets do not go into the room with my game, but there have been cats and dog in the same house as this game. A really excellent game, but the solo experience never clicked with me. Navajo Wars_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039; theme made me want to try... but alas, on to the next gamer. Shipping is from 04011(local pickup around the Brunswick/Freeport/Topsham area is cool), USPS, package will weigh 4lbs. 3oz. This should fit in a medium flat rate box if that ends up being cheaper. Shipping paid by buyer. Let me know if you have any questions.

Navajo Wars is in excellent condition. The game has been set up for the tutorial twice but never really played. The rulebooks have been read and show some wear. The counters are clipped and stored in a counter tray. There is no insert, but the insert had to go to make room for the counter tray. There is some very minor shelf wear on the box. This copy is in excellent condition and comes from a smoke-free home. Shipping in the US will be $11.35. It will ship using USPS Priority Mail (medium flat-rate box).

For sale is an open, punched copy of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Navajo Wars_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; from GMT Games. I bought this game from a previous owner who had played it once. Upon receiving the game, I opened the box to marvel at the components, but couldn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t set it up as I was packing to move to a new home, and since then it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s sat in my cabinet wrapped in bubble wrap. Hence, this copy has only enjoyed one play. All the original components are present and in original condition. The mounted board is in a ziplock bag. In addition to the original books and cards, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m including color-printed copies of the Living Rules and Play Book, as well as the errata. I prefer to ship via USPS. The game will fit within a Priority Mail™ Medium Flat Rate Box, which costs $12.65. If I can find a smaller box, though, we may be able to get the price down a bit. Let me know if you have another shipping option to consider. In addition to PayPal, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll accept Google Wallet, for which the fees are lower.
